definition: a short break or escape from something difficult or unpleasant
a short delay allowed before something difficult or unpleasant must be done
to tell somebody what you think they should do in a particular situation
to give somebody help and information on a subject that you know a lot about
to officially tell somebody something
to come or go down from a higher to a lower level
to slope downwards
to arrive and begin to affect somebody/something
to move along smoothly and slowly in water or air
to move or go somewhere slowly
to do something, happen or change without a particular plan or purpose
to go from one situation or state to another without realizing it
to be blown into large piles by the wind
to make something float somewhere
a person who is sent to deliver an official message, especially from one country to another, or to perform a special task
a feeling of being jealous
an action or a remark that shows that a person is jealous
to think that somebody/something is not good or suitable; to not approve of somebody/something
to officially refuse to agree to a plan, request, etc.
a device that receives a radio signal and then sends out a different signal in reply
the opportunity or ability to do or achieve something
the range of things that a subject, an organization, an activity, etc. deals with
an instrument for looking through or watching something with
to take somebody’s attention away from what they are trying to do
to make somebody/something change direction
to use money, materials, etc. for a different purpose from their original purpose
to take somebody’s thoughts or attention away from something
to entertain people
having a particular centre
based on a particular way of thinking
the practice of training people to obey rules and orders and punishing them if they do not; the controlled behaviour or situation that is the result of this training
a method of training your mind or body or of controlling your behaviour; an area of activity where this is necessary
the ability to control your behaviour or the way you live, work, etc.
an area of knowledge; a subject that people study or are taught, especially in a university
to a degree that is fairly good but not very good
in a logical and sensible way
in a fair way
a general description or an outline of something
an increase in the price of something based on the difference between the cost of producing it and the price it is sold at
the symbols used in computer documents that give information about the structure of the document and tell the computer how it is to appear on the computer screen, or how it is to appear when printed
the process or result of marking or correcting a text, etc., for example for printing
the way that somebody drives a vehicle; the act of driving
to be the person in control of a situation
involving, or done by, several people or groups of people working together
deeply unconscious; in a coma
extremely tired and having no energy; sleeping deeply
to put an end, often by force, to a group or an activity that is believed to threaten authority
to prevent something from being published or made known
to prevent yourself from having or expressing a feeling or an emotion
to prevent something from growing, developing or continuing
to heat an oven to a particular temperature before you put food in it to cook
a period of time between two events
a short period of time separating parts of a play, film or concert
a short period during which something different happens from what is happening the rest of the time
a difference in pitch (= how high or low a note sounds) between two notes
an activity in interval training
with time between
with spaces between
to give up the position of being king, queen or emperor
to fail or refuse to perform a duty
a person whose job is to treat disease, injury or weakness in the joints or muscles by exercises, massage and the use of light and heat
to surprise or shock somebody; to make somebody unable to think clearly
the process of using information you have in order to understand a particular situation or to find the answer to a problem
the process of taking an amount of something, especially money, away from a total; the amount that is taken away
a complicated, confused or embarrassing situation that causes many problems, especially in politics
to separate and go in different directions
to be different
to be or become different from what is expected, planned, etc.
the fact of being more interested in making money than in the value or quality of things
to use something to try to make a profit, especially in a way that other people do not approve of
to mix two or more things together or to be mixed, especially when it is impossible for the things to be separated afterwards
an expression of sympathy for somebody who has had something unpleasant happen to them, especially not winning a competition
to develop a wider range of products, interests, skills, etc. in order to be more successful or reduce risk
to change or to make something change so that there is greater variety
(in the past) the part of the army that fought on horses; the part of the modern army that uses armoured vehicles
stopping and starting often over a period of time, but not regularly
a strong desire for more wealth, possessions, power, etc. than a person needs
a strong desire for more food or drink when you are no longer hungry or thirsty
a strong desire for more wealth, possessions, power, etc. than a person needs
the feeling of having a strong desire for the things that other people have

to get very angry
to tend to get angry quickly and easily
to come together to form one larger group, substance, etc.
to combine with something else; to make something combine with something else
wanting more money, power, food, etc. than you really need
used to refer to somebody who eats too much
